Container.Name: TwentyFourSeven
Container.Overview: TwentyFourSeven - A modern full-stack TypeScript application with Next.js frontend and API backend. Features include user authentication, real-time updates, beautiful modern UI, and NVIDIA GPU hardware acceleration. Perfect for self-hosted environments with built-in SQLite database.
Container.Requires: NVIDIA GPU Driver must be installed on Unraid host. Install the "NVIDIA-Driver" plugin from Community Apps if you haven't already.

Config.Name: HTTP Port
Config.Description: Main HTTP port for the application. This is the only port you need to access TwentyFourSeven.

Config.Name: External HTTP Port
Config.Description: Automatically set to match the HTTP Port above. Used for internal URL configuration.

Config.Name: Trusted Origins
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for authentication. REQUIRED for external access! Example: http://localhost:[PORT:80],http://192.168.1.100:[PORT:80] (replace 192.168.1.100 with your Unraid server IP)

Config.Name: Authentication Secret
Config.Description: Secret key for authentication. Leave empty to auto-generate a secure key. For production, set a strong custom secret (32+ characters).

Config.Name: Enable GPU Detection
Config.Description: Enable automatic GPU detection and hardware acceleration support.

Config.Name: Enable Hardware Acceleration
Config.Description: Enable hardware-accelerated video transcoding when supported GPU is detected.

Config.Name: NVIDIA Visible Devices
Config.Description: Make NVIDIA GPUs visible to container. Set to 'all' for all GPUs or specific GPU IDs (e.g., '0,1'). If you have multiple GPUs and want to use specific ones, find GPU IDs with 'nvidia-smi -L' on your Unraid host.

Config.Name: NVIDIA Driver Capabilities
Config.Description: NVIDIA driver capabilities for hardware acceleration. - DO NOT CHANGE unless you know what you're doing.

Config.Name: Database Storage
Config.Description: Path to store the SQLite database. Leave empty for ephemeral storage (data lost on container restart). If you see database permission errors, run: chown -R 1001:100 /mnt/user/appdata/twentyfourseven/database in the Unraid terminal.

Config.Name: Static Files Storage
Config.Description: Path to store static files (.m3u, .xml, etc.). Files placed here will be accessible at http://[IP]:[PORT]/files/. If you see permission errors, run: chown -R 1001:100 /mnt/user/appdata/twentyfourseven/static in the Unraid terminal.

Config.Name: Hardware Acceleration Device
Config.Description: Hardware acceleration device path. For NVIDIA use /dev/nvidia0, for Intel/AMD use /dev/dri/renderD128.

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Application log level (debug, info, warn, error).

Config.Name: Timezone
Config.Description: Timezone for the container (e.g., America/New_York, Europe/London, etc.).

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User ID for file permissions. Use 'id username' command to find your user ID.

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID for file permissions. Use 'id username' command to find your group ID.
